title: How to Swordfight at Roblox's Sword Fights on the Heights Original

steps.headline: Start training: Starting to train is the first path to become better at Sword fighting.
Choose other places to train.
steps.description: You can choose one or more places to train. Some good places are Roblox, Builderman and Shedletsky's places.

steps.headline: Train with people.
steps.description: Fighting people of different skill levels is good to start learning.

steps.headline: Try to get higher ratios: A 2:1 ratio would be a good start.
Make counterattacks.
steps.description: Most people usually separate defense from attack, which can be a disadvantage. Try to combine defense with attack and you will get good results mostly.

steps.headline: Dedicate yourself to sword fighting.
steps.description: Don't stop training unless you are too busy.

steps.headline: Learn from other sword fighters.
steps.description: Looking at enemy movements can help you to learn new moves.

steps.headline: Practice your sword fighting style.
steps.description: Every sword fighter has a unique style while at fighting, you should see and explore what's yours!

steps.headline: Learn the 3 styles.
steps.description: Learn to sword fight with Moonwalk, Classic, and Mouse Lock styles.

steps.headline: Make duels.
steps.description: Dueling is a good way to train.

steps.headline: Avoid dangerous zones.
steps.description: Zones like the 4 spawns area can be really dangerous.

steps.headline: Use the ropes.
steps.description: Using the black ropes can be useful to escape from swords.

steps.headline: Find tricks around the maps.
steps.description: Using the height for your advantage can be a really good tip.

steps.headline: Get armor.
steps.description: Getting armor can make you harder to kill.

steps.headline: Avoid the lava zone.
steps.description: It can trip you and make you fall off the bricks.

steps.headline: Camp.
steps.description: Camping at SFOTHO can be useful sometimes.

text: Start training: Starting to train is the first path to become better at Sword fighting.  Choose other places to train. You can choose one or more places to train. Some good places are Roblox, Builderman and Shedletsky's places. Train with people. Fighting people of different skill levels is good to start learning. Try to get higher ratios: A 2:1 ratio would be a good start.  Make counterattacks. Most people usually separate defense from attack, which can be a disadvantage. Try to combine defense with attack and you will get good results mostly. Dedicate yourself to sword fighting. Don't stop training unless you are too busy. Learn from other sword fighters. Looking at enemy movements can help you to learn new moves. Practice your sword fighting style. Every sword fighter has a unique style while at fighting, you should see and explore what's yours! Learn the 3 styles. Learn to sword fight with Moonwalk, Classic, and Mouse Lock styles. Make duels. Dueling is a good way to train. Avoid dangerous zones. Zones like the 4 spawns area can be really dangerous. Use the ropes. Using the black ropes can be useful to escape from swords. Find tricks around the maps. Using the height for your advantage can be a really good tip. Get armor. Getting armor can make you harder to kill. Avoid the lava zone. It can trip you and make you fall off the bricks. Camp. Camping at SFOTHO can be useful sometimes.

Some good places are Roblox, Builderman and Shedletsky's places.

Fighting people of different skill levels is good to start learning.
Try to get higher ratios: A 2:1 ratio would be a good start.
Make counterattacks.

Try to combine defense with attack and you will get good results mostly.

Don't stop training unless you are too busy.

Looking at enemy movements can help you to learn new moves.

Every sword fighter has a unique style while at fighting, you should see and explore what's yours!

Find tricks around the maps.

Get armor.
Getting armor can make you harder to kill.
Avoid the lava zone.
It can trip you and make you fall off the bricks.
Camp.
Camping at SFOTHO can be useful sometimes.
